syllabus:
**ENGLISH III—English for Science & Technology**

**Fall Semester 2019**

**Mondays, 13:20—15:10, Gong-Guan Campus**

**Thursdays, 10:20—12:10, Main Campus**

**Instructor:**  Jean E. Curran, Office: 誠714

**Goal**: The goal of this course is to help students develop their English proficiency so that they will be better able to comprehend and use English in the courses they study in their major and in their daily lives. Through a series of talks, discussions, and projects, students will work on developing their speaking, listening, reading, writing, and vocabulary skills. The readings in this class will particularly focus on  science, health, nutrition, fitness, and sports.  

**Objectives**:

1.  To help students continue to develop the skills they will need to employ when reading, listening, or discussing materials related to science and technology that have been published in English.

1.  To teach students to think critically about the issues addressed in the readings and in class.

1.  To provide classroom opportunities for the discussion of thoughts and ideas generated from students’ use of critical thinking skills.

1.  To develop students’ presentation skills so that they can effectively prepare and deliver a presentation in English.

1.  To provide opportunities through the use of homework to allow students to show their understanding of the course content.

1.  To give students opportunities to apply English skills to tasks required for their own majors.    

1.  To introduce students to some of the online resources available in English that are devoted to science and technology topics. 

1.  To provide students with opportunities to explore other materials on science and technology topics that are of global interest.

**Textbook**

There is no textbook for this course. Materials will come from a variety of sources that publish information related to science and technology including AsapScience, National Geographic, Scientific American, The New York Times, and Time. Students will be asked to contribute toward the cost of copying the materials.

**Requirements**
================

**1.  Attendance and Preparation**

It is very important that students attend class on a regular basis and that students prepare any homework assignments.  If you miss class frequently, points will be deducted from your final grade for the course, and it is possible that you may fail the course.  Please arrive for class on time. Continually arriving for class late will be viewed as an absence.  

**2.  Participation**

It is expected that students will be active participants in the learning process.  

**3.  Projects**

Students will be asked to complete a number of individual and group projects related to the material and activities in the textbook.
